revised_title: Analytical Applications of High-Resolution Nuclear Magnetic Resonance Spectroscopy of Solids
tldr: This article discusses the analytical chemical applications of high-resolution nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR) spectroscopy of solids. It describes the cross-polarization-magic-angle spinning (CP-MAS) experiment, which provides high-resolution NMR spectra of solid materials. The technique is useful for analyzing amorphous systems, crystalline materials, and chemically exchanging solid systems, offering a bridge between solid-state and solution structures.
